page.title: 13OLD BUILDINGS IN GODMERSHAM
page.content: A 13C Stone Court Lodge, demolished in 1955 is now being excavated to uncover the foundations of the original house, a chapel dating from 1289 and the solar from 1313. The church of St. Lawrence contains every major style of architecture from 1066-1500. A 15C Hall House built by Thoams Pope still stands at Pope Street. Dane House (1578) was the dower house to Chilham Castle from 1780-1920. The donkey wheel and well house beside Eggarton Manor is 16C and still intact. The only other working example is at Carisbrooke Castle (Isle of wight). Godmersham Pakr(1732) is a palladian style mansion with an interior rich in plaster work. In the grounds is a dovecote and a "folly". The Great Barn (1400)later the Rectorial Tithe Barn, is 121ft long with a crown post at the north end.
